languages.name: Python
languages.description: Learn Python basics through small practical exercises.

exercises.title: Hello, Python
exercises.prompt: Write a program that prints the text: Hello, Python
hints: Use the print function.
Pass the text as a string inside print().

exercises.title: Add Two Numbers
exercises.prompt: Create a program that prints the sum of 3 and 5.
hints: Add the two numbers using the + operator.
Store the result in a variable before printing.

exercises.title: Variable Assignment
exercises.prompt: Assign the value 10 to a variable named x and print it.
hints: Use the = operator to assign a value.
Make sure x is printed, not the number directly.

exercises.title: String Length
exercises.prompt: Print the length of the string 'Python'.
hints: Python has a built-in function to get length.
Use len(text) inside print().

exercises.title: Simple Condition
exercises.prompt: Print 'Yes' if 5 is greater than 3, otherwise print 'No'.
hints: Use a comparison operator like >.
Place the print statements inside the if and else blocks.

languages.name: JavaScript
languages.description: Practice JavaScript fundamentals with simple exercises.

exercises.title: Hello, JavaScript
exercises.prompt: Write a program that logs 'Hello, JavaScript' to the console.
hints: Use console.log to print output.
The text should be inside quotes.

exercises.title: Add Numbers
exercises.prompt: Log the result of adding 4 and 6.
hints: Use the + operator to add numbers.
Assign the result to the variable before logging.

exercises.title: Variable Output
exercises.prompt: Create a variable named x with value 7 and log it.
hints: Use let or const to declare a variable.
Log the variable name, not the value directly.

exercises.title: String Length
exercises.prompt: Log the length of the string 'JavaScript'.
hints: Strings have a length property.
Use text.length inside console.log().

exercises.title: Conditional Check
exercises.prompt: Log 'Correct' if 10 is equal to 10, otherwise log 'Wrong'.
hints: Use a comparison operator like ===.
Put the correct message inside the if block.

languages.name: SQL
languages.description: Learn basic SQL queries and syntax.

exercises.title: Select All
exercises.prompt: Write a SQL query to select all columns from a table named users.
hints: Use * to select all columns.
End the query with a semicolon.

exercises.title: Select Specific Column
exercises.prompt: Write a SQL query to select the name column from users.
hints: Place the column name after SELECT.
The table name comes after FROM.

exercises.title: Where Clause
exercises.prompt: Select all users where age is greater than 18.
hints: Use the > operator for comparison.
Conditions go after the WHERE keyword.

exercises.title: Order Results
exercises.prompt: Select all users ordered by created_at descending.
exercises.expected_answer: SELECT * FROM users ORDER BY created_at DESC;
hints: Use ORDER BY to sort results.
DESC means descending order.

exercises.title: Limit Results
exercises.prompt: Select the first 5 users from the users table.
hints: Use LIMIT to restrict the number of rows.
The number comes after the LIMIT keyword.
